[align=center][font=Impact]POSSIBLE SPOILERS BELOW![/SIZE][/font][/align]
[font=Lucida Sans Unicode][b][color=sandybrown]2010 F1 Championship standings: [/SIZE][/b][/font][/align]
[align=center][color=palegreen]1. [b]Red Bull Racing-Renault[/SIZE][/b] - [COLOR=white]330[color=palegreen] [COLOR=lemonchiffon][b]Mark Webber(AUS)[/b] - [COLOR=white]179 :: [b]Sebastian Vettel(GER)[/b] - [color=white]151[/align] [align=center]2.[b] McLaren-Mercedes[/SIZE][/b] - [color=white]329 [color=lemonchiffon][b]Jenson Button(GBR)[/b] - [COLOR=white]147 :: [b]Lewis Hamilton(GBR)[/b] - [color=white]182[/align]
[align=center]3. [b]Ferrari[/SIZE][/b] - [color=white]250 [color=lemonchiffon][b]Fernando Alonso(FAG)[/b] - [COLOR=white]141 :: [b]Felipe Massa(BRA)[/b] - [color=white]109[/align]
[align=center]4. [b]Mercedes GP[/SIZE][/b] - [color=white]146 [color=lemonchiffon][b]Michael Schumacher(GER)[/b] - [COLOR=white]44 :: [b]Nico Rosberg(GER)[/b] - [color=white]102[/align]
[align=center]5. [b]Renault[/SIZE][/b] - [color=white]123 [color=lemonchiffon][b]Robert Kubica(POL)[/b] - [COLOR=white]104 :: [b]Vitaly Petrov(RUS)[/b] - [color=white]19[/align]
[align=center]6. [b]Force India-Mercedes[/SIZE][/b] - [color=white]57 [color=lemonchiffon][b]Adrian Sutil(GER)[/b] - [COLOR=white]35 :: [b]Vidantonio Liuzzi(ITA)[/b] - [color=white]12[/align]
[align=center]7. [b]Williams-Cosworth[/SIZE][/b] - [color=white]40 [color=lemonchiffon][b]Rubens Barrichello(BRA)[/b] - [COLOR=white]30 :: [b]Nico Hulkenberg(GER)[/b] - [color=white]10[/align]
[align=center]8. [b]BMW Sauber-Ferrari[/SIZE][/b] - [color=white]15 [color=lemonchiffon][b]Kamui Kobayashi(JAP)[/b] - [COLOR=white]15 :: [b]Pedro de la Rosa(SPA)[/b] - [color=white]0
9. [b]Scuderia Toro Rosso-Ferrari[/SIZE][/b] - [color=white]11 [color=lemonchiffon][b]Sebastien Buemi(CHE)[/b] - [COLOR=white]7 :: [b]Jaime Alguersuari(SPA)[/b] - [color=white]3[/align]
[align=center]10. [b]Lotus-Cosworth[/SIZE][/b] - [color=white]0 [color=lemonchiffon][b]Heikki Kovalainen(FIN)[/b] - [COLOR=white]0 :: [b]Jarno Trulli(ITA)[/b] - [color=white]0[/align]
[align=center]11. [b]HRT-Cosworth[/SIZE][/b] - [color=white]0 [color=lemonchiffon][b]Bruno Senna(BRA)[/b] - [COLOR=white]0 :: [b]Karun Chandhok(IND)[/b] - [color=white]0[/align]
[align=center]12. [b]Virgin-Cosworth[/SIZE][/b] - [color=white]0 [color=lemonchiffon][b]Timo Glock(GER)[/b] - [COLOR=white]0 :: [b]Lucas di Grassi(BRA)[/b] - [color=white]0[/align]

item.title: Formula 1 Thread
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Not being biased for and against lewis, I gotta say that he had his steering wheel locked.
And when Schumi passed him in the very same place, he gave in.

So yeah, I can understand where he’s coming from, but nonetheless he acted like quite a dick.

P.S. LOOOOOOOOOOl
Prime tyres on Vettel was a mistake.
Luckerrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr
P.S.S. Coulthard and his white jeans are n the pool now too.

Read full topic

item.title: Formula 1 Thread
item.dc:creator: mental2k
item.description:
He’s decided that he’s being victimised. Then the interviewer asked him why, and he said “Maybe it’s cause I’m black” then realised he’d went a bit far and said “as Ali G would say”. He seems to think that he can do no wrong. Personally I don’t like that in a driver.

Read full topic

item.title: Formula 1 Thread
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
He did let Schumi through in a similar situation.
Also, RedBulls are such fucking ravers.
Gotta love the team. Vettel - not so much.
Although he is one of those chaps I’d love to be friends with.

P.S. LOL @ Eddie Jordan losing his contacts in Red Bulls’ pool.

Read full topic

item.description:
Luck is what makes Monaco so special : 70% of safety car during the race.
What’s Lewis problem ?

item.title: Formula 1 Thread

item.description:
It’s these new Pirelli tyres, it’s like they’re trying to replicate the effect of fuel stops, without fuel stops.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
It just gets to me how many time Button did everything 120% right and then because of some luckers ended up 2nd or 3rd.

Better luck in Canada.

Petrov has a sore ankle apparently.

item.title: Formula 1 Thread
item.dc:creator: mental2k
item.description:
I agree for the spectacle of the thing they should have kept the tyres the same. But rules is rules.

“Is it cause I’m black” No Lewis, it’s cause you keep driving into people!

Read full topic

item.title: Formula 1 Thread
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Not to give new tyres to anyone during Red Flag time. You want new tyres - be so kind, withdraw 24 seconds.
In Monaco, giving new tyres under red flag is just like giving free godmode to whoever is first. Who wrote these rules?

Vettel = lucker. Yeah, whatever. See you in Canada.

Read full topic

item.title: Formula 1 Thread
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
Awesome race with lots of great overtaking. A lot of the overtaking was from the DRS though, they still need to tweak it a bit more this year, it was more of a slingshot at Turkey, making it far too easy. Great race though, 1-2 xD

Also Webber is going to win next week, since the start of the year he has finished 5th, 4th, 3rd and 2nd, in that order :awesome:

Read full topic

item.title: Formula 1 Thread
item.dc:creator: OldDirtyBastard
item.description:
Turkey GP. What a fantastic and disappointing race.

Read full topic

item.title: Formula 1 Thread
item.dc:creator: Mith
item.description:
best race since 2008 season final imo

Read full topic

item.title: Formula 1 Thread
item.dc:creator: jambo
item.description:
One of the best races I’ve seen in years, so much overtaking and so many of the cars made it around in 1 piece. I think I heard it was a record for the number of cars completing the race. Webber storming from 18th to a podium finish was just amazing. All the new tactics with the Pirelli’s are brilliant, really bringing F1’s back to real racing!

Even my housemate who doesn’t follow the F1’s was glued to the tele.

Bring on Turkey!

Read full topic

indeed it’s not.
He’s strong in 2011 tho.
